Abstract: Russian stock prices rise to their highest levels since 1998 economic collapse in expectation that Vladimir V Putin, new acting president, will revive stalled economic reforms (M)
Snippet: Russian stock prices rise to their highest levels since 1998 economic collapse in expectation that Vladimir V Putin, new acting president, will revive stalled economic reforms (M)
LeadParagraph: President Boris N. Yeltsin's resignation today drove Russian stocks to their highest levels since the 1998 economic collapse, reflecting hope among investors that the acting president, Vladimir V. Putin, would revive stalled economic reforms.

Headline.Main: Heartened Investors Give Stock Market a Lift
Headline.PrintHeadline: YELTSIN RESIGNS: THE ECONOMY; Heartened Investors Give Stock Market a Lift
